III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 allegedly put her hands around Youth P's neck causing
bruising.
Investigation I notified Foster Care Worker of this investigation assignment.
She expressed no concerns about the facility.
I coordinated a joint investigation with Government Worker 1.
I contacted Rights Officer who said Youth P made a verbal
complaint about the alleged incident last week. He looked into the
complaint and found no evidence that it occurred, but Youth P
disagreed with his findings and called in the complaint herself.
I reviewed the facility’s history of licensing violations.
There are no cameras in the laundry room.
VIDEO of hall
3:31pm Staff 1 unlocks the laundry room door for Youth P and
stands in the hall using her foot to prop open the door. Youth P
enters the laundry room alone.
3:32 – 3:34pm Youth P is in the laundry room alone. Staff 1 is in
the hall propping the door open.
3:34pm Staff 2 walks through the hall, enters the laundry room,
exits with a broom and sweeps the hallway.
3:35:40pm Youth P exits the laundry room.
Youth P is the complainant. I interviewed Youth P jointly with
Government Worker 1 on 7/13/23. She has been at Vista Maria
for one month. On 7/2/23 Youth P said she and Staff 1 were
conversing inside of the laundry room. “I asked why she (Staff 1)
had to watch me do laundry. She got snippy and put her hand like
this.” Youth P demonstrated by putting her hand against her right
clavicle. “There was a bruise (that no one saw) but it’s gone
now…I couldn’t lift my shoulder for two days.”
Youth P said no other staff or youth saw this occur. “She (Staff 1)
did it in the laundry room where there’s no cameras.” Youth P
2

said she filed a complaint with Rights Officer. “He (Rights Officer)
checked the cameras in the hall and didn’t see it.” Youth P
admitted that prior to this incident, she and Staff 1 did not get
along well.
A medical progress note dated 7/6/23 indicates Youth P
complained of shoulder pain that originated on 7/3/23. “Doctor
stated youth has a muscle strain and should rest.” Rights Officer
reported Youth P had been swimming several days previously
which could explain the muscle strain.
I interviewed Staff 2 jointly with Government Worker 1 and Quality
Managers 1 and 2 present. Staff 2 has worked at the facility over
a year. She did not recall seeing anything unusual between Staff
1 and Youth P. However, she said at some point, Staff 1 was
“agitated” with Youth P after the youth called her “grandma.”
I interviewed Supervisor jointly with Government Worker 1 and
Quality Managers 1 and 2 present. She has been an afternoon
shift supervisor for two years. Supervisor was unaware of any
incident in the laundry room. However, she said Youth P has been
very “disrespectful” to Staff 1 and other staff.
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker 1 and Quality
Managers 1 and 2 present. She has worked at the facility part-
time for a year. Government Worker 1 read the allegation aloud to
Staff 1. Staff 1 responded, “None of that happened. I never
touched her…I wasn’t ever alone in the laundry room with her. I
stood outside the door having a conversation…Rights Officer
investigated and said there’s no evidence.”
Staff 1 explained that prior to Youth P making this allegation,
Youth P had made racial slurs toward her calling her a “stupid
black bitch.” “She (Youth P) had been arguing with me. I asked
Supervisor to be removed from the wing.”
Staff 1 became increasingly escalated during the interview saying
she will not tolerate disrespect from youths. She referred to
“being lied on” by Youth P and was still visibly angry toward her.
Staff 1 was also visibly offended when Government Worker 1
asked her routine mandatory questions about her personal life.
There are no disciplinary write-ups in Staff 1’s employee file.
Rights Officer’s written notes dated 7/6/23 indicated Supervisor
reported Youth P uses the word “rachet, asked if her food was
3

made by “a black person,” and makes offensive comments toward
multiple staff.
Staff 1 said Youth P repeatedly uses the “N word” and targets
people’s race and sexual orientation. “She talks about nasty shit
when she finds out about my romantic partner and threatens to
“get one of these black mother fuckers fired.”
Government Worker 1 had no findings to their investigation.
Analysis Evidence does not support the allegation.
CONSULTATION
It appears Staff 1 has strong feelings about Youth P disrespecting
her. I recommend they do not work together until a mediation/
debriefing session can be held and feelings resolved and possible
some additional training for Staff 1.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
